title: What are the disadvantages of illiteracy? How do people stay illiterate? - Quora

response.answer_text: You cannot read a map, newspaper, job adverts, create a CV, get a non-manual job or promotion. You are socially restricted to others with a limited vocabulary. You have low self-esteem - sometimes evident in violence to bolster low self esteem. Feelings of inadequacy and shame. There are many more things that will affect a person with low/no literacy, which is a shame because often it is no fault of their own, just the failure of the education system as everybody learns at different ages, not all at the same time - especially when young. The oldest and youngest in an elementary class have a vast difference in brain development and capability.

“How do people stay illiterate” - Yes, lots of people lived their life as illiterate for a long period. The skills like that of agriculture and inventing wheel were done when people were illiterate. The greatest disadvantage is in passing on skills. If you do not write it down and something happens before you are able to hand it over to some one, it is lost.
